intro: Gastrolobium pyramidale, commonly known as the narrow-leaf wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions such as Western Australia and South Australia. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, attracting various pollinators. The plant has adapted to arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native environment.
